details.content:
Congress spokesperson Randeep Surjewala begins press conference, citing The Caravan's report which alleged that former Karnataka CM Yeddyurappa had bribed BJP leaders during his tenure.

LIVE: Press briefing by @rssurjewala, I/C, AICC Communications. https://t.co/7qJbVgwOrm

— Congress Live (@INCIndiaLive) March 22, 2019
Surjewala is reading the contents of the diary which reportedly holds details of a transaction between BS Yeddyurappa and BJP leaders.

details.title: Surjewala questions Modi's silence on the matter
details.content: Is it true or false? The diary with BS Yeddyurappa's sign on it was with the Income Tax Department since 2017. If that is the case, why did Modi ji and BJP did not get it investigated?: Randeep Surjewala

details.title: Rs 1800 crore bribery charge against top BJP leaders: Congress
details.content: The diary mentions names of senior BJP leaders from Rajnath Singh to Jaitley. There is an allegation of bribe worth Rs 1800 crore against BJP's top leadership, says Randeep Surjewala
We have caught a theft and the thief. BJP leaders have been caught in a corruption case: Surjewala

From this diary, five facts have come out. Close to Rs 2690 crore was sought and 1800 crore was given to BJP. Yedyurappa was the CM during the period. There are his signatures on each page. This was given to BJP's central team, claims Surjewala

details.title: Divya Spandana replies to BJP's attack over Congress delaying their press meet
details.content:
No of press conferences by @RahulGandhi - 24
No of press conferences by @narendramodi 0
Darpok Modi! Darpok BJP! https://t.co/9mpoDhjVzq

— Divya Spandana/Ramya (@divyaspandana) March 22, 2019

details.title: What the Caravan report says
details.content: "The copies of the diary pages note that Yeddyurappa paid the BJP Central Committee Rs 1,000 crore; that he paid the finance minister Arun Jaitley and the transport minister Nitin Gadkari Rs 150 crore each; that he gave the home minister Rajnath Singh Rs 100 crore; and that he paid the BJP stalwart LK Advani and the senior party leader Murli Manohar Joshi Rs 50 crore each. Besides this, the entry notes, Yeddyurappa paid Rs 10 crore for ‘Gadkari’s son’s marriage’,” the Caravan report says.

details.title: The Caravan tweets that their website is down, and will be back shortly
details.content:
Copies of diary entries that are with the IT dept note that BS #Yeddyurappa paid the BJP central committee 1,000 crore; Arun Jaitley and Nitin Gadkari 150 crore each; Rajnath Singh 100 crore; and LK Advani and Murli Manohar Joshi 50 crore each. https://t.co/gO74cY6KN8 pic.twitter.com/aR5AftXtSx

— The Caravan (@thecaravanindia) March 22, 2019

details.title: Yeddyurappa rebuts allegations
details.content:
BS Yeddyurappa, BJP: They have planted the story in the media to gain mileage in the upcoming elections. Issues raised by Congress leaders are irrelevant and false. I'm discussing with the senior advocates to file a defamation case against the concerned person also. https://t.co/lECh5weSVG

— ANI (@ANI) March 22, 2019
